Require a numeric PIN or password to decrypt your phone each time you power it on

"You can encrypt your accounts, settings, downloaded apps and their data, media, and other files. Once you encrypt your phone, you need to type a numeric PIN or password to decrypt it each time you power it on. You can't decrypt your phone except by performing a factory data reset, erasing all your data.
Encryption takes an hour or more. You must start with a charged battery and keep your phone plugged in until encryption is complete. If you interrupt the encryption process, you will lose some or all of your data."

"The encryption operation is irreversible and if you interrupt it, you'll lose data. Encryption takes an hour or more, during which the phone will restart several times."

"Encryption was interrupted and can't complete. As a result, the data on your phone is no longer accessible.
To resume using your phone, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your phone after the reset, you'll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account."

"When this feature is turned on, you can beam app contents or files to other NFC and Wi-Fi Direct devices by holding the devices close together. For example, you can beam browser pages, contacts, YouTube videos and more. And you can beam images/videos from the Gallery, music from the Music app, and documents from the Polaris Office. Just bring the devices together (typically back to back) and then touch your screen. The app determines what gets beamed."

"When this feature is turned on, you can beam app contents or files to other NFC and Bluetooth devices by holding the devices close together. For example, you can beam browser pages, contacts, YouTube videos and more. Just bring the devices together (typically back to back) and then touch your screen. The app determines what gets beamed."

When this feature is turned on, you can beam app content or files to other NFC and Bluetooth devices by holding them close together. For example, you can beam browser pages, contacts, images and videos from the Gallery and more.

When this feature is turned on, you can beam app content or files to other NFC and Bluetooth devices by holding them close together. For example, you can beam browser pages, images and videos from the Gallery and more. Direct Beam transfers data faster between LG phones.

"When Direct/Android Beam is turned on, you can beam app content or files to other mobile devices by holding them close together.
1. NFC and Wi-Fi Direct devices are needed. 2. Turn on Direct/Android Beam on each device. 3. Select the screen or files to share (e.g. images from the Gallery). 4. Hold devices together (e.g. back to back). 5. Tap the screen that you want to send after shrinking the screen. (Each app determines what is sent or received.)
* Data that can be shared: browser pages, contacts, YouTube videos, images from the Gallery, music from the Music app, documents from Polaris Office."

"When Android Beam is turned on, you can beam app content or files to other mobile devices by holding them close together.
1. NFC and Bluetooth devices are needed. 2. Turn on Android Beam on each device. 3. Select the screen or files to share (e.g. images from the Gallery). 4. Hold devices together (e.g. back to back). 5. Tap the screen that you want to send after shrinking the screen. (Each app determines what is sent or received.)
* Data that can be shared: browser pages, contacts, YouTube videos, images from the Gallery, music from the Music app, documents from Polaris Office."

To tether your phone connect your phone to a computer with a USB cable and on your phone tap to select \"USB tethering\" located under \"Settings >> More… >> Tethering & Mobile HotSpot\". Tethering works with Windows®7, Windows Vista®, and Linux. For more information on tethering with operating systems, go to www.android.com/tether .
For Windows XP, you may have to install a USB driver on your computer before you can tether your phone. To install the drivers enter the following URL on your computers browser.

You can also temporarily magnify what's under your finger by triple-tapping and holding. In this magnified state, you can drag your finger to explore different parts of the screen. Lift your finger to return to your previous state.
Note: Triple-tap for magnification works everywhere except the keyboard and navigation bar."

"When this feature is turned on, you can quickly enable accessibility features in two steps:

If the device has multiple users, using this shortcut on the lock screen temporarily enables accessibility until the device is unlocked."

"If you turn location \"ON\" and activate a third party location based service on this handset, you consent to U.S. Cellular's use of and disclosure to such third party of this handset's location. Turning location \"ON\" will allow U.S. Cellular to track the location of this handset and share such information with third party providers of location-based services. Once this handset's location information is transferred from U.S. Cellular to the third-party location-based service provider, that third party's privacy policy will govern subsequent uses of your location information. You should carefully review the terms and conditions and associated privacy policy of each such location- based service for information regarding how the third party provider of that service will use, disclose, protect and retain your location information. Such uses may include, but not be limited to, offering you location-based promotions and sharing your location with others."

"U.S. Cellular uses a variety of commercially reasonable and appropriate safeguards to protect location information residing on our systems from unauthorized access or disclosure including, without limitation, server firewalls and physical facility security. We also restrict access to location information to only those work groups that need to know that information for their job function. No security is perfect, however, and U.S. Cellular cannot guarantee the security of your location information. U.S. Cellular does not guaranty the accuracy or completeness of location information delivered through its network, and any location-based service may be disrupted or fail due to environmental factors and factors affecting satellite usage. You should understand the risks involved in consenting to the disclosure of your handset's location information before requesting a location based service and inform users to whom you provide your handset that his or her location can be tracked."

"Turning location \"OFF\" will hide the location of this handset from everyone except U.S. Cellular, the entities to which U.S. Cellular may disclose your location information as permitted by law, including but not limited to public safety, fire service or law enforcement officials in emergency situations, and third party providers of location-based services that track the location of this handset without U.S. Cellular's cooperation."

"You can encrypt your system data(accounts, settings, downloaded applications and other files) stored in the internal storage by pressing the corresponding \"Encypt device\" button below. Once you encrypt your phone, you will be required to enter a numeric PIN or password to decrypt it each time you power it on: you cannot un-encrypt your device except by performing a factory reset, erasing all your data.
Encryption takes an hour or more. You must start with a charged battery and keep your device plugged in until encryption is completed. If you interrupt the process, you will lose some or all of your data."
Require a numeric PIN or password to read encrypted data on SD card when PIN or password is changed without mounted SD card

"You can encrypt your user data(downloaded applications, media and other files) stored in the internal storage or the SD card by pressing the corresponding \"Enable encryption\" button below. After you have enabled encryption, you may choose to disable it by pressing \"Disable encryption\" button. Once you encrypt your storage, you will be required to enter a numeric PIN or password to read encrypted data on SD card when PIN or password is changed without mounted SD card.
Only the data created or updated after enabling encryption on the storage you have selected will be encrypted. Any data created or updated prior to enabling encryption will remain unencrypted. Once data is encrypted, you will not be able to use it in other devices. (Any data that is created or updated after disabling encryption will not be encrypted but the data that has been previously encrypted will remain encrypted.)
If you perform a factory reset, you are not able to read the encrypted data stored in the internal storage or the SD card even if you do not check 'Erase SD card'. If you want to keep your data, backup the data before you perform a factory reset. If you interrupt the process, you will lose some or all of your data."

Step 1. Set other Bluetooth device to pairing mode

To connect your phone with other Bluetooth device, the device you want to pair with must be in the pairing mode. Once you paired the device with your phone, turn it on and select the device from your phone.
The followings are typical ways to set Bluetooth device to the pairing mode.
In case of headsets, input devices, etc.
Followings are typical examples of setting pairing mode.
See the manual that came with your device for more details.
In case of phones, PC, etc.
Set pairing mode on other phones, computers, etc.
Turn Bluetooth on and make it visible.
Step 2. Search a Bluetooth device to pair with
Touch Search for devices button to start searching your Bluetooth device. Please revisit the previous step if the device you want to pair with is not on the list.
Step 3. Pair with a Bluetooth device
Touch the device in the search list to pair with and follow the instructions to complete the pairing.
If you are asked to enter PIN , try entering 0000 or 1234( the most common password), or check the user guide.
Step 4. Connect to a Bluetooth device
If you are trying use headsets, keyboards, etc wirelessly, you need to connect to the devices.
To connect to the devices, touch the device on the paired device list or press any key of the paired device.
If you have paired with this device before, simply turn on your phone and select the device.
Make sure the device is in the pairing mode.
Make sure the device is visible.
